name: Framebuffer.bash
tagline: framebuffer in bash to draw ascii pixels, borders, animate e.g. (bash ui bootstrap)
body: ### Why Fullfledged html/css/javascript applications are nice, but sometimes a simple email with asciitext does the job. This is for minimalists and productivity fanatics. ### Barcharts! will produce something like this: apple : ——▄▄▀▀——▀▀▄▄——▄▄▀▀▄▄——— banana : ▁▁▂▂▃▃▄▄▅▅██▄▄▂▂▁▁▁▁▁▁▁ plum : ██████ orange : ████ apple : ██ foo : ██████████ code example: put 2 3 "stock :"; echo "0,1,2,0,2,1,0,1,2,1" | barchart 10 2 20 put 2 7 "banana :"; redis-cli --csv LRANGE foo 0 -1 | sed 's/[^0-9,\\-]*//g' | vbarchart 10 6 20 ### Histograms! turns logs into: UFW 1600 █████████████████████████ cfg80211: 11 █████████████ wlan0: 9 █████ ath: 8 █ code example: dmesg | histogram 2 25 25 ### Animations! code example: animate 2 4 0.1 ". o O o" ### Boxes! ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │date: Mon May 19 23:43:45 CEST 2014 │ │ │ └──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ code example: box 1 1 20 10; put 2 2 "date: $(date)"
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
